channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ME
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ME

item.title: Report I-2023060102
item.description:
Report I-2023060102

  • Carrier/Reporter: YRC INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading one drum was found punctured and Leaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged drum was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2023060357
item.description:
Report E-2023060357

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: S PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 26, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of sulfuric acid experienced a broken cap and released approximately sixteen (16) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group Inc. (GSS) to remediate the site. GSS personnel deployed neutralizing agent to the area and secured the tote's cap. The crew then utilized absorbent wipes to remove any residual product. All sulfuric acid impacted material was collected in one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023050688
item.description:
Report X-2023050688

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: BANGOR
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 5th, The employee at the BGRA station noticed a damaged package inside of the can. Through the damage they could see a white metal jerrican that had a flammable liquid label on the side. There were more cans that appeared to be paint can like. There were no markings on the outside of the package indicating and hazards were inside the box. DG Admin advised the station to hold the shipment until further disposition.
